benchmark_details.name: Two Twitter Datasets for Economic Narrative Analysis
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces two curated datasets from Twitter that capture economy-related narratives and tests their predictive power for macroeconomic forecasting by incorporating these narratives in downstream financial prediction tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To empirically test the Narrative Economics hypothesis and explore the predictive power of narratives extracted from social media for macroeconomic indicators.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The practical utility of learned narratives for economic applications remains an open question.

data.source: Two Twitter datasets capturing economy-related narratives.
data.annotation: Curated using targeted queries and analyzed for quality and relevance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on prediction accuracy over specified forecasting horizons.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates a better predictive capability of narratives in financial behavior.
methodology.baseline_results: Model performance compared against traditional statistical methods and financial benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Models were validated using historical financial data in an 80-20 train-test split while maintaining temporal context.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential risks of misuse if technology is applied in unfair ways.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data is publicly sourced with user-generated content from Twitter.
